item.title: Best short paper award at EACL 2014 for Andrei Olariu
item.description: Andrei Olariu‘s paper, Efficient Online Summarization of Microblogging Streams, has been awarded the best short paper award at EACL 2014. Congratulations, Andrei!
item.dc:creator: nlp

item.title: Paper accepted at ACL 2014
item.description: Our paper, Automatic Detection of Cognates Using Orthographic Alignment, by Alina Maria Ciobanu and Liviu P. Dinu, has been accepted as a short paper in ACL 2014.
item.dc:creator: nlp

item.title: Four papers accepted at EACL 2014 and collocated workshops
item.description:
The following papers will be presented at EACL 2014:

  • Efficient Online Summarization of Microblogging Streams, by Andrei Olariu

  • Predicting Romanian Stress Assignment, by Alina Maria Ciobanu, Anca Dinu and Liviu P. Dinu

  • Temporal Text Ranking and Automatic Dating of Texts, by Vlad Niculae, Marcos Zampieri, Liviu P. Dinu and Alina Maria Ciobanu

  • A Quantitative Insight into the Impact of Translation on Readability, by Alina Maria Ciobanu and Liviu P. Dinu (PITR workshop)

  • On the Syllabic Structure of Aromanian, by Sergiu Nisioi (LATECH workshop)
item.dc:creator: nlp

item.title: Four papers accepted at LREC 2014
item.description:
The following papers have been accepted at LREC 2014:

  • Building a Dataset of Multilingual Cognates for the Romanian Lexicon, by Alina Maria Ciobanu and Liviu P. Dinu

  • On the Romance Languages Mutual Intelligibility, by Alina Maria Ciobanu and Liviu P. Dinu

  • Using a Machine Learning Model To Assess the Complexity of Stress Systems, by Alina Maria Ciobanu, Liviu P. Dinu, Ioana Chițoran and Vlad Niculae

  • Aggregation Methods for Efficient Collocation Detection, by Anca Dinu, Liviu P. Dinu and Ionuț Sodoroc
item.dc:creator: nlp

item.title: Paper accepted at ECIR 2014
item.description:
The folowing paper has been accepted at ECIR 2014:

CiteSeerX: A Scholarly Big Dataset, by: Cornelia Caragea, Jian Wu, Alina Ciobanu, Kyle Williams, Juan Fernandez-Ramirez, Hung-Hsuan Chen, Zhaohui Wu, and C. Lee Giles
item.dc:creator: nlp

item.title: Two papers accepted at JSSP 2013
item.description:
The following papers have been accepted at JSSP 2013:

  • Alternative Measures of Word Relatedness in Distributional Semantics, by Alina Maria Ciobanu and Anca Dinu

  • Comparison Pattern Matching and Creative Simile Recognition, by Vlad Niculae
item.dc:creator: nlp
